name: Addington Arms Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: We stayed at the Addington Arms Inn during our travels through Nova Scotia and had to write to tell others what a wonderful stay we had there. We were on the top floor overlooking the water in the most incredable room it was actually a 3 room suite at hotel standards. The view was beautiful, the room was very large and so beautifull, the breakfast was delicious and our hosts were the mose hospitable couple we have met yet in our B & B stays. We would highly recommend this Inn to anyone going through this area as a must do. There is even a steam shower in the bathrooms!
reviews.title: wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Addington Arms earlier this month, when we were in Lunenburg for the Folk Harbour Festival. It was our second time at the festival and at the Addington Arms, which I found through an internet search in 2003. Both of our stays were wonderful, and I recommend this B&B wholeheartedly.
reviews.title: One of our favorite B&Bs anywhere!
This May be the Best B&B
reviews.text: What drew me to the Addington Arms when I visited the website originally was the size of the rooms, their separate seating areas, and their distinctive decor. We stayed in the Flying Jib room on both stays, and were not disappointed. In addition to its harbor view, the purple walls and modern and interesting furnishings were a welcome change from the "fussy doily" look in many B&Bs. There was plenty of space to relax when we wanted a break from the festival, and it was an easy walk from the B&B to anywere in town. The Addington Arms rates a best B&B bathroom award for its gorgeous sea green mosaic tile walls and nifty looking tile floor. These innkeepers don't skimp on towels either.

reviews.title: The best B&B in Nova Scotia!!!
reviews.text: Christine and Dan are exceptionally thoughtful and welcoming hosts who go the extra mile for their guests -- helpful in their suggestions and generous with their time and efforts. Dan's breakfasts, served in an attractive dining room, make delicious use of seasonal local ingredients and keep you fueled for much of the day. Chris has made it a point to sample the restaurants in town, and she knows which ones to recommend (or not). It felt like seeing old friends when we came in the door for our second visit. We're also among the many fans of Bodacious (Beau), their friendly and mellow big dog.

Lunenburg, a UNESCO historic site, is known for its harbor scenery, its history with the Bluenose, and its architecturally distinctive old houses, many in superb shape and painted in adventuresome colors that remind me a bit of San Francisco on a smaller scale. Lunenburg also makes an excellent base for exploring this part of Nova Scotia.

reviews.title: We loved the Addington Arms
loved Lunenburg b&b
reviews.text: We spent 2 weeks traveling through Nova Scotia, starting with Lunenburg. I happened upon a b&b called Addington Arms, that was not listed with many of the websites. Felt we were taking a chance, but the pictures on their website were so beautiful, and the rates were very reasonable. What a wonderful place!! Beautiful suites, with many amenities, incredable breakfasts each morning, delightful hosts, and located right in the middle of town, making it easy to walk anywhere. We would definately go back here and recommend it to all.

A lovely inn, wonderfully restored and maintained. The rooms are not cluttered with aging pieces; decorated nicely but not over the top. The bathrooms all new with a wonderful steam shower. The Heritage Suite, our room, was large with a spectacular view of the bay; although the bed was quite soft (not our preferrence). The room faces a busy street, therefore, the thoughtfully provided sound machine comes in handy if you like to sleep with the windows wide open (as we do). The pictures and descriptions on the website are accurate. Breakfast was always well prepared, hearty and good. Chris is very knowledgeable and helpful, always pointing us in the right direction. Again, really a lovely inn.
reviews.title: Lovely Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Addington Arms B & B for two nights last week. What a wonderful place! The rooms are enormous, clean, and filled with helpful guides and menus to nearby restaurants. We stayed in the Top Sail suite, and were very impressed by the size of the bright bathroom with double steam shower. Chris and Dan were great hosts, and the breakfasts were wonderful (mushroom omelets one day, lemon ricotta pancakes the next). We found it to be probably the nicest place we stayed on our entire honeymoon, and are looking forward to going back! Thanks Chris and Dan! Lunenburg is also a lovely city to walk around in - we ate at Magnolia's and Fleur-de-sel with great results.
reviews.title: Great time at the Addington Arms
Love the Addington Arms B&B

aka: Addington Arms Bed And Breakfast Lunenburg, Nova Scotia
description: The Addington Arms B&B sits atop 2 fine art galleries and atop the six square block historic district of this UNESCO world heritage site, affording ocean views from all of our suites and room. Shopping, dining and exploring are all just steps outside your front door. We are not your typical B&B but more akin to a boutique hotel, with stocked mini fridges, TV's and en-suite steam-rooms with aroma therapy or an air-jet tub in very spacious surroundings. On-site parking is available as street parking is problematic in the summer months. Our breakfasts are as memorable as the town of Lunenburg itself.
